quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Black Sea and Sea
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, nicknames, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Not counting Istanbul, which of these cities is located on Bosphorus on the side of the Sea of Marmara and is the biggest city on the coast of the Black Sea?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Odessa, Ukraine

questions.question: From the viewpoint of physical geography and ecology, the Ukrainian territories to the north of the Black Sea are known to contain what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steppes or plains

questions.question: Topeka is the capital city of which U.S. state?

The Black Sea drains into the Atlantic Ocean via the Sea of Marmara and the Mediterranean Sea on the South West. On the other, North East side of the Black Sea, there is a small sea which is connected to the Black Sea via the Strait of Kerch. Name this sea.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sea of Azov

questions.question: Which of these nicknames refers to the U.S. state of Idaho?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gem State

questions.question: The Black Sea city of Sukhumi is the capital of this republic that proclaimed its independence from Georgia in the 90s.
The summit ridge of Mount Everest marks the border between which two Asian countries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China and Nepal

questions.question: The Black Sea reaches the maximum depth of 2,210 m. Its neighbor, the Sea of Azov, is unique in terms of sea depth for what reason?

options.text: Its floor sinks constantly because it is located on a large basalt plate.
It is the shallowest sea in the world.
It has almost perfectly flat sea floor with a depth of 1370 m.
It has no established sea floor, it changes constantly with currents.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the shallowest sea in the world.

questions.question: The names of three large rivers flowing into the Black Sea begin with a letter D. Danube, the largest of the three, flows through ten European countries and enters the Black Sea in Romania. The other two end their flow in this country.
Six countries are located along the Black Sea border. Which one among them has the longest Black Sea coast line (not including the Sea of Azov coast line)?
All these entities are located around the Black Sea except for one. Name the exception.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ural mountains

questions.question: The Black Sea, whose waters are known to be meromictic, is the largest water basin in the world where water layers do not intermix, and, thus, lack the dissolved form of what?
What does the name of the U.S. state of Utah mean in the Ute language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: People of the mountains

questions.question: Saint Paul is the capital city of what US state?
The Crimean peninsula has been under the control of multiple powers over the centuries. Although it is considered to be an autonomous republic, it is a part of this nation.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Planet and Island
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, peak, death. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Himalayan range, part of which is Mount Everest, stretches across five different countries in Asia. Which of the following countries is not among them?
Edmund Hillary, the first mountaineer to reach mount Everest, was from what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Zealand

questions.question: The highest mountain in the world is named after Sir George Everest, a famous Welshman. What was his profession?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Surveyor and geographer

questions.question: What nationality was Junko Tabei - the first woman to reach the peak of Mount Everest?
What nationality was mathematician and surveyor Radhanath Sikdar, who was the first person to measure the height of Everest?
This is the largest European island, and the ninth-largest island on the planet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What is the largest island of Canada, and the fifth-largest island in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baffin Island

questions.question: The term death zone refers to high altitudes, where the amount of oxygen cannot sustain human life and altitude acclimatization becomes impossible.  While this definition still applies, mount Everests death zone is significantly more difficult to survive.  Why?

options.text: Visibility is decreased due to constant snowstorms
Extremely low temperatures result in quick freezing of body parts
High wind velocity causes deadly avalanches
Polar bears pose a serious threat to climbers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Extremely low temperatures result in quick freezing of body parts

questions.question: This island, located north of Australia, is the second-largest island on the planet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Guinea

questions.question: This Italian climber, who was in the first expedition to reach Mount Everest without oxygen tanks, later became the first person to climb the summit alone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reinhold Messner

questions.question: Which of the following paths is one of the two most popular climbing routes to Mount Everest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The southeast ridge from Nepal

questions.question: This is the third-largest island on the planet, and it is also known as Kalimantan.
What is the largest island on the planet in terms of territory?
The locals of Nepal call the highest mount in the world - Mount Everest -  Sagarmatha. What is the meaning of this name in Sanskrit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Head of the Sky

questions.question: This is the fourth-largest island in the world, and it is home to 5% of the plant and animal species on the planet.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Person and Island
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, locations, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The first time Antarctica was officially visited is a subject of controversy. Three people have claimed to have achieved this feat. Which of these is not one them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Cook

questions.question: Which nation claims ownership of the South Pole?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No nation does.

questions.question: What happened at the North Pole on August 3, 1958?

options.text: The northernmost US city, Naavetau, was founded.
The first airport in the Arctic was built.
A submarine travelled underwater under the Pole.
The last Arctic Moa was killed.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A submarine travelled underwater under the Pole.

questions.question: What is the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea?
Who is given credit  for being the first person to reach the North Pole?
In 2000, microbes were found at the South Pole.
The temperature at the North Pole is higher than the temperature at the South Pole.
What is the most populous island in the world?
The capital of this island country is Kingston.
In 1728, he became the first person to sail into the Arctic Ocean and proved that Asia and North America are not joined by land.
Who was the first person to reach the South Pole?
This island is located in the Indian Ocean and is also known as Ceylon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sri Lanka

questions.question: The geographic North and South Poles are at fixed locations and have not moved.
Few animals inhabit the North Pole. Which of these types of animals can never be seen there?
Which statement is true about the explorer and glaciologist Albert P. Crary?

options.text: He was the first person to set foot on Antarctica.
He was the first pilot to fly across the South Pole.
He was the first person to build a home above the Arctic Circle.
He was the first person to reach both the North and South Poles.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was the first person to reach both the North and South Poles.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: River and Europe
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, country, filipino. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What river named after a mythological figure is the longest river of Great Britain?
In what country does the River Po rise?
This bridge, that spans the Tagus River, is the longest bridge in Europe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vasco da Gama Bridge

questions.question: How would you say What is your name? in Tagalog?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ano ang pangalan mo?

questions.question: What is the longest river in Poland and the ninth longest in Europe?
What river that flows through Spain and Portugal is the longest river on the Iberian Peninsula?
The Filipino word Bulaklak means flower in English.
What is the longest river in France?
The Filipino word maganda means beautiful in English.
The Filipino word pangalan means name in English. What does the word pangngalan mean?
What river flows through ten European countries and is the longest in the European Union?
What river rises in the northwestern Czech Republic, flows through Germany and into the North Sea?
Where are the origins of the Rhine?
What river, draining into the Caspian Sea, is the longest in Europe?
What does the Filipino word lungsod mean in English?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Island and Years
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, douglas, coffee. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This island, the second largest in the world, is shared by Indonesia and another country. Because of its impenetrable swamps, jungles and towering mountains, it wasnt explored by outsiders until the past 100 years, and new tribes of humans with stone-age societies are still being discovered in the interior.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Guinea

questions.question: What Filipino word means money in English?

This island is the third largest in Indonesia, and is probably known for its coffee. It is also home to unique (and endangered) species of elephants, tigers, and rhinoceroses. It is also one of two islands which have indigenous orangutans.
Which of these describes best the location of the volcanic island of Krakatau (sometimes erroneously called Krakatoa), which had a well-known and devastating eruption on August 23, 1883?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Between Java and Sumatra

questions.question: How will you say I Love You in Filipino?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mahal Kita

questions.question: Which Indonesian island was in the news in 2003 when the remains of an extinct variety of small hominids (popularly referred to as Hobbits), measuring about 3 feet in height, were found there?
This multifunctional facility is located at 225 West Douglas, Wichita, Kansas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Century II Convention center

questions.question: These islands were the original spice islands, which have drawn traders from all over the world for thousands of years, and were a major factor in causing the European age of exploration, as explorers set out to find the fabled East Indies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ternate, Tidore and Banda

questions.question: Who is considered the Father of Filipino Language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manuel Quezon

questions.question: Wichita, a major aircraft manufacturing hub and cultural center, is the capital of Kansas.

This volcano, located on the island of Sumbawa, erupted in 1815, generally regarded as the largest volcanic eruption in recorded history. The eruption killed thousands, and changed global climatic patterns.
What does the Filipino word salita mean in English?
Wichita, the county seat of Sedgwick County, is nicknamed what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Air Capital

questions.question: This western half of this island is part of Indonesia, while the eastern half is a nation which gained independence in 2002, following hundreds of years of European colonialism and 25 years of Indonesian occupation.
Which Indonesian island is shared by four Indonesian provinces and two other nations: the eastern half of Malaysia and the tiny oil-rich sultanate of Brunei?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Italy and Maryland
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, exporter, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the meaning of the name of Italy according to scientists who have studied its origin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Land of young cattle

questions.question: What is the shape of the Italian Peninsula?
The first European to explore the Chesapeake Bay surrounded by modern day Maryland and Virginia was the Italian Giovanni da Verrazzano.
What is the meaning of the Italian word riavvolgere, from which the name of the popular Italian dish ravioli originated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To wrap

questions.question: Maryland Day is celebrated every year on what date?

options.text: The first day of crab season

questions.question: Italy is a major world exporter of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: McConnell Air Force Base is a United States Air Force base located in Sedgwick County, near Wichita, Kansas.
Which of these colors is not present on the national flag of the Italian Republic?
Maryland is well known as a colony of religious tolerance.  It was the first American colony to fully accept practitioners of which religion?
What is the capital and largest city of Italy?
In which of these years did the Italian national football team win the FIFA World Cup?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What large mountain range is located entirely within the territory of Italy?
What is the name of the European peninsula on which Italy is located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Italian Peninsula

questions.question: What is the title of the national anthem of the Italian Republic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Song of the Italians

questions.question: Which was the seat of colonial government in Maryland until 1708?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Mary’s City
